channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: WIRED Health Recap: Cancer Vaccines, CRISPR Breakthroughs, and More

item.description: The White House’s new Make America Healthy Again strategy makes some asks of the EPA—but critics say the agency is too industry-friendly to make a dif...

item.title: OpenAI Ramps Up Robotics Work in Race Toward AGI
item.description: The company behind ChatGPT is putting together a team capable of developing algorithms to control robots and appears to be hiring roboticists who work...

item.title: The Next Era of Gene Editing Will Be Disease Agnostic
item.description: At the WIRED Health summit, pioneer David Liu said his lab is on the verge of revealing a new gene-editing technique that could target multiple unrela...

item.title: Liquid Glass Could Be One of Apple's Most Divisive System Designs Yet
item.description: As Apple’s radical redesign rolls out across all of its platforms today, designers and app creators are still unconvinced it delivers the “greater foc...

item.title: Karen Hao on the Empire of AI, AGI evangelists, and the cost of belief
item.description: OpenAI’s rise isn’t just a business story — it’s an ideological one. On Equity, Karen Hao, author of Empire AI, explores how the cult of AGI has fuele...

item.title: OpenAI board chair Bret Taylor says we’re in an AI bubble (but that’s okay)
item.description: Like OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Bret Taylor thinks we're in an AI bubble — but he doesn't sound too worried about it.

item.title: iPhone 17, iPhone Air, AirPods Pro 3, and everything else announced at Apple’s hardware event
item.description: From a new slim iPhone Air model to redesigned AirPods, here's what was announced at this year's Apple event.

item.title: Users turn to chatbots for spiritual guidance
item.description: At least one website claims to allow users to chat with God.

item.title: Vibe coding has turned senior devs into ‘AI babysitters,’ but they say it’s worth it
item.description: TechCrunch spoke to experienced coders about their time using AI-generated code about what they see as the future of vibe coding.
